events.summary: The European Commission is to look into whether Elon Musk's Grok AI chatbot is spreading illegal content in the EU. Among other things, Grok has been used to make manipulated sexualized images, often of women and minors.

events.title: Germany: Business index starts year with 'little momentum'
events.summary: Germany's Ifo business barometer was stagnant in January, bucking predictions of a slight improvement. A dip in confidence in the service sector put the brakes on improved sentiments in other areas.

events.title: EU pushes for deals as Trump's tariffs upset global trade
events.summary: Fear over Trump's tariff walls and the aggressive tone coming from the White House is pushing the European Union to focus on getting other trade agreements done. Despite all efforts, the EU sometimes gets in its own way.

events.title: EU agrees on complete ban of Russian gas imports by 2027
events.summary: The European Union has taken another step toward ending its energy reliance on Russia by agreeing to stop gas imports from the country. But not all countries voted in favor of the ban.

events.title: Media freedom in the spotlight as Kuciak murder case reopens
events.summary: Europe presents itself as a defender of the free press, yet some high-profile murders of EU journalists have yet to be resolved. Will a new trial into the death of Slovak journalist Jan Kuciak change that?

events.title: Germany news: Bounty offered over Berlin power grid attack
events.summary: German authorities have offered a €1 million bounty for tips related to this month's massive Berlin blackout. Meanwhile, European leaders discussed energy and security cooperation in Hamburg. DW has more.

events.title: Calls grow for European teams to boycott World Cup 2026
events.summary: As with Russia in 2018 and Qatar in 2022, politics are dominating the buildup to North America's 2026 World Cup. Could discontent with Donald Trump in Europe see football heavyweights unite to boycott the tournament?

events.title: Russia looks to India to fill labor shortage
events.summary: Russia needs workers — and is now hiring in India. Why Moscow is shifting its migration strategy, and what awaits Indians arriving in Russia.

events.title: US–EU economic ties show why neither side can decouple
events.summary: Despite a pause in tariff escalation, US–EU trade remains volatile under Donald Trump. From deficits and energy to services and the dollar, the trans-Atlantic relationship reveals deep ties — and clear vulnerabilities.

events.title: Blood supplies running low in Germany
events.summary: A shortage of blood donations in Germany could have dramatic consequences. The situation was critical in mid-January. DW's Marcel Fürstenau answered a call to donate blood and reported on his experience.

events.title: Germany weighs boon and bane of China's industrial expansion
events.summary: From cheap exports to cutting-edge tech: A Chinese battery giant's secretive factory in Germany shows how "Made in China" and "Made in Germany" are colliding — and where they can benefit from each other.

events.title: Merz says Germany won't join Trump's 'Board of Peace'
events.summary: German Chancellor Merz said the current form of US President Trump's "Board of Peace" prevented Germany from joining for "constitutional reasons." But Merz said he was open to "new formats" of cooperation with the US.

events.title: 'Sweet Caroline' singer Neil Diamond turns 85
events.summary: He was a pop icon in the 1970s. Today, one of his songs is experiencing a viral resurgence. From soccer stadiums to TikTok, Neil Diamond's "Sweet Caroline" hasn't stopped playing.

events.title: Germany investigates Russian espionage case
events.summary: After identifying a suspected agent, Germany has expelled a Russian embassy employee and summoned the Russian ambassador.

events.title: Former Scorpions bassist, Francis Buchholz, dies aged 71
events.summary: The musician's family said he died following a battle with cancer. Buchholz played bass for the Scorpions rock band until 1992, during one of their most successful periods.

events.title: Rodman becomes new 'highest paid' women's footballer
events.summary: USA forward Trinity Rodman has re-signed with the Washington Spirit of the National Women's Soccer League in a deal that will reportedly pay her in excess of $2 million per season.

events.title: Trump, Zelenskyy, Carney dominate Davos 2026: As it happened
events.summary: The World Economic Forum has come to an end after a tense but ultimately anti-climactic week at Davos, with the US, Ukrainian and Canadian leaders attracting the most attention. Read DW's wrap of the summit.

events.title: Germany: Nord Stream suspect cannot claim immunity
events.summary: German judges have nixed an appeal by a Ukrainian national suspected of helping blow up an underwater gas pipeline to be freed from prosecution. Neighboring Poland is refusing to extradite his alleged co-conspirator.

events.title: Can China rely on domestic oil after Iran, Venezuela shocks?
events.summary: Donald Trump's moves against two key suppliers have revived debate over China’s fragile oil balance. With domestic output flat and oil fields aging, how much capacity — if any — exists to raise production?

events.title: Merz and Meloni reshape Germany-Italy relations
events.summary: Chancellor Friedrich Merz and Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni are showing closer ties than their countries have in years. Meloni is no longer seen as a right-wing outsider, taking on a role as mediator with Donald Trump.

events.title: 'Sinners' breaks records at 2026 Oscar nominations
events.summary: The film by Ryan Coogler earned 16 nods for the 98th Academy Awards, which will be presented on March 15. A new Oscar category was also introduced for the first time in 25 years.

events.title: From Inuit to Vikings to Trump: The history of Greenland
events.summary: After being inhabited only by Indigenous peoples for centuries, the Arctic island saw the Vikings in the 10th century and the Danes in 1721, and it attracted US interest back in 1867.

events.title: Germany: Far-right extremist 'Saxon Separatists' stand trial
events.summary: The trial of 8 suspected right-wing extremists accused of planning a coup is beginning in the German city of Dresden. Their goal: A Nazi state.

events.title: Davos: Germany's Merz says old world order 'unraveling'
events.summary: German Chancellor Merz said the world has "entered an era of great power politics" where Russia and China challenge the US. In his speech at Davos, Merz said Europe must boost competitiveness and invest in defense.

events.title: UN backs boost in nature-saving business
events.summary: Global financing is heavily skewed to industries that harm rather than preserve nature, according to a new report that calls for an urgent scale-up of nature-positive spending.

events.title: Davos WEF: Trump touts policies, renews Greenland ambitions
events.summary: Donald Trump used his WEF speech to praise himself and lash out at Europe while offering little on the economy. Business and political leaders were expecting the worst, but much of it was for a domestic audience.

events.title: Germany's rail service dealt major blow by government
events.summary: The government is reportedly walking back promises to fund major projects for national train operator Deutsche Bahn. DB is beset by chronic punctuality problems, decrepit infrastructure and a lack of investment.

events.title: European Parliament votes to delay Mercosur deal in court
events.summary: Lawmakers voted narrowly to challenge the EU trade deal with Latin America in the bloc's top court, a move that could derail the deal. Chancellor Friedrich Merz said the deal should be provisionally enacted anyway.

events.title: Free solo climb on Netflix: 'If you fall, you're gonna die'
events.summary: Rock climber Alex Honnold plans to scale the facade of what was once the world's tallest building — live on Netflix. But not all are impressed by the idea.

events.title: Apple overtakes Samsung in phones sales worldwide
events.summary: After 14 years behind Samsung, Apple is back on top in global smartphone sales, just as Chinese rivals step up the pressure. Foldables and advanced AI are the new battleground in the fight for the next billion users.

events.title: Germany sees thousands join pro-Kurdish protests
events.summary: German cities saw large pro-Kurdish demonstrations on Tuesday as Syrian government troops clash with Kurdish forces in northeastern Syria.

events.title: WEF in Davos: Is Greenland the wake-up call Europe needed?
events.summary: Europe faces waning influence amid wars, trade tensions, climate inaction and a US administration quick to hurl insults at its oldest allies. In Davos, leaders discuss how Europe can regain its mojo.

events.title: Halabja Massacre: Survivors still haunted by chemical weapons strike
events.summary: Kurdish Iraqis who survived the 1988 chemical weapons attack on Halabja and nearby communities have lasting trauma, a new report finds, highlighting the need for long-term support.

events.title: How bringing back a humble algae to Arctic waters makes all the difference
events.summary: For decades, researchers in northern Norway had tried to bring back vital kelp forests after overfishing damaged marine ecosystems. Now a simple solution is proving successful.

events.title: Iran's economic woes expose regime's tight grip
events.summary: As religious elites and Revolutionary Guards strengthen their hold on the economy, experts question how long the regime can survive.

events.title: African fans fume at 'disgraceful' World Cup travel ban
events.summary: Senegal's football team are champions of Africa, but fans from the country are banned from going to the US for the World Cup. They aren't the only ones, with Donald Trump's hostility and FIFA ticket prices hitting hard.

events.title: Like potatoes? Berlin is giving away 4 million kilos
events.summary: As an initiative redistributes a bumper surplus of spuds, here's a look at the Germans' great love affair with the potato.

events.title: How can the EU respond to US 'blackmail' over Greenland?
events.summary: European leaders have three main options for responding to the Trump administration’s economic threats. If they don’t get it right, Trump may be emboldened to take over Greenland.

events.title: Meet Veronika, the clever cow with tools to scratch herself
events.summary: A cow in Austria has been observed using tools ― the first time such behavior has been recorded in cattle. Have we underestimated the gentle bovines all this time?

events.title: Why Germany probably won't get political at 2026 World Cup
events.summary: After their very public protest at the last World Cup in Qatar, Germany's football team looks unlikely to do the same in the United States in 2026.

events.title: 'Sentimental Value' sweeps European Film Awards. Next step, Oscars?
events.summary: Joachim Trier's drama won the top accolades, adding to the buzz ahead of the Oscar awards. Iran was also in the spotlight, with director Jafar Panahi decrying the government's brutal crackdown on protest.

events.title: WEF: Donald Trump set to dominate Davos 2026
events.summary: Weeks after attacking Venezuela, capturing its controversial leader, and reviving Greenland ambitions, the US president's presence in Davos is expected to raise the stakes at the WEF's annual meeting.

events.title: 8 fun facts about Dolly Parton for her 80th birthday
events.summary: Dolly Parton is one of the world's most successful artists. Now 80, she has an eventful life to look back over. Here are some important and extraordinary facts about the country music icon.

events.title: How European cinema is stealing Hollywood's spotlight
events.summary: As Hollywood doubles down on sequels, the contenders for the European Film Awards feature bold, political works that are challenging audiences and creating buzz far beyond the continent.

events.title: 2026 stargazing: Eclipses, meteor showers and supermoons
events.summary: 2026 will leave stargazers spoiled for sights in the sky, with four eclipse events, multiple meteor showers and several supermoons.

events.title: German firms hunker down as Trump marks one year in office
events.summary: One year into Donald Trump's second term, higher tariffs and sharper threats are straining transatlantic business. German companies in the US are weighing compliance against resistance as uncertainty grows.

events.title: Livestream: 4 award-winning filmmakers discuss risk-taking cinema
events.summary: DW co-hosts a talk with European Film Award and Oscar nominees Jafar Panahi, Oliver Laxe, Mascha Schilinski and Joachim Trier. Watch it live here.

events.title: NBA Europe to 'respect' European basketball tradition
events.summary: The NBA is pressing ahead with plans to launch a basketball league in Europe, with a slated launch date of 2027.

events.title: 'Charlie Hebdo' cartoon on Swiss fire tragedy sparks outrage
events.summary: A cartoon by the French satirical weekly portraying the deadly fire in Crans-Montana as the "comedy of the year" provokes disgust.

events.title: Women poised to take India sports to the next level
events.summary: India has been experiencing major growth in women's sports in recent years. This is being fuelled by investment from both the public and private sector – as well as many role models.

events.title: Wikipedia at 25: Of collective knowledge and its fault lines
events.summary: From utopian origins to AI-driven rivals, the "people's encyclopedia" has been shaped by debates over neutrality, expertise and the future of shared knowledge.

events.title: Louvre hikes ticket price for non-EU visitors by almost half
events.summary: The Louvre museum and several other French cultural sites are increasing the price of entry for visitors from outside Europe. So-called "dual pricing" is quite common in less wealthy countries but rare in richer regions.

events.title: International Space Station crew to make emergency return to Earth
events.summary: A medical emergency will force four astronauts aboard the International Space Station to return to Earth prematurely.

events.title: From the Monroe Doctrine to the Donroe Doctrine
events.summary: America for Americans: That was James Monroe's message to European colonial powers in 1823, to respect the independence of new nations of the Americas. Trump is reinterpreting this doctrine.

events.title: Kazakhstan oil output plunges as Ukraine's drones hit Russia
events.summary: Kyiv's attacks on Russian oil terminals and refineries may damage their enemy, but they are also having an impact on other economies such as Kazakhstan's and risk alienating allies.

events.title: Australians are changing their response to wildfires
events.summary: DW's Stuart Braun had a dangerously near miss during Australia's 2009 "Black Saturday" inferno. As this month's fires burned near his rural home, he wasn't taking any chances.

events.title: Australia: Writers' festival called off amid boycott
events.summary: The Adelaide Writers' Week retracted an invitation to an Australian-Palestinian author, citing the the Bondi Beach attack. Dozens, including the event's director and the former PM of New Zealand, withdrew in response.

events.title: Cannabis: Now you can measure how much is too much
events.summary: At what point does smoking weed get dangerous? A British study measured cannabis consumption in THC units and determined which amounts increase health risks. The system comes with clear risk thresholds ― and weaknesses.

events.title: Cheating scandal hits Winter Olympics skeleton qualifier
events.summary: An international sports governing body is investigating after a Canadian coach was accused of manipulating an event — depriving racers of qualifying points ahead of February's Winter Olympics.

events.title: Why Venus Williams and other sports stars are playing longer
events.summary: More than three decades after she burst onto the tennis scene, Venus Williams is still playing at the top level. Why are we seeing elite athletes carrying on into their 40s and beyond?

events.title: 2026 World Cup: Germany to be based at North Carolina hotel
events.summary: Germany will be making a hotel in Winston-Salem their base camp during next summer's World Cup. The choice of headquarters has been seen as key to the national team's success — or failure — at previous World Cups.

events.title: From Guatemala to Panama: US affairs in Latin America
events.summary: The US attack on Venezuela is part of a long history of military interventions and political influence by the United States in Latin America. Here are five such examples since World War II.

events.title: Jack London felt 'Call of the Wild,' lived life of adventure
events.summary: The Klondike gold rush, wolves in the Alaskan snow, adventures on the high seas: Jack London, author of "The Call of the Wild" and "The Sea Wolf," was born 150 years ago. DW looks at his life.

events.title: The impact of US withdrawal from global climate pacts
events.summary: The US has pledged to pull out of dozens of international organizations and treaties established to advance the protection of the planet. But it doesn't spell the end of environmental action.

events.title: What to watch out for as the Bundesliga resumes play
events.summary: Bayern Munich seem to have another Bundesliga title all but sealed. But could a serious challenger still emerge? And who is in danger of relegation? DW has you covered.

events.title: Ski jumping: 'Are they trying to pull a fast one on us?'
events.summary: Domen Prevc has followed in his brother's footsteps by winning the Four Hills Tournament. However, more than the Slovenian's achievement, this year's edition may be remembered for less pleasant reasons.

events.title: How clean energy could save us trillions
events.summary: As clean energy prices fall, a fast transition to renewable energy is the cheapest option on the table. Experts say it could save us trillions in energy costs alone.

events.title: T20 World Cup cricket: Why Bangladesh won't travel to India
events.summary: A month before the tournament begins, Bangladesh have said they will not play T20 World Cup matches in India. The decision comes on the back of political and sporting tensions between the countries.

events.title: Can developing countries leapfrog fossil fuels?
events.summary: Rich nations built their wealth on coal, oil and gas. Now the world is asking poorer countries like Mozambique to chart a different course.

events.title: Why plastic bans aren't working and what needs to change
events.summary: Four years after Germany phased out light plastic bags, how has the EU addressed plastic waste? And why do single-use items still pile up in takeaway restaurants, shops and the environment?

events.title: Anthony Joshua discharged from hospital after Nigeria crash
events.summary: The British heavyweight sustained injuries in a car crash that killed two of his friends.

events.title: Solar desert power: Inside China's mega farm
events.summary: China may be the world's number one polluter in real time, but Beijing is also driving the world's most ambitious renewables rollout, at breakneck speed. China is now home to nearly a third of the world's total installed solar and wind capacity, although it's yet to kick the coal habit. Our colleagues at France 2 visited some of the country’s flagship projects.

events.title: 'It's important to finalise the EU-US trade agreement': EU Economy Commissioner Dombrovskis
events.summary: As Europe faces unprecedented geopolitical headwinds, from the Ukraine war to Donald Trump’s designs on Greenland, we speak to the EU Commissioner in charge of the economy, productivity, and simplification: Valdis Dombrovskis. A former prime minister of Latvia, Dombrovskis is very much a Brussels insider, serving in various high-profile roles in the EU Commission since 2016, and as a member of the European Parliament in 2004-2009.

events.title: Bulgaria's entry into the EU single currency: A historic shift
events.summary: On January 1, Bulgaria officially joined the eurozone, becoming the 21st country to join the European single currency. Sofia's adoption of the euro brings hope of major economic benefits, but it also comes at a moment of deep political polarisation and mass anti-corruption protests, which culminated in the resignation of both the country's government and president.

events.title: Benin's 18-year-old cycling prodigy hopes to lead the way for more female cyclists
events.summary: It is a first in the history of Beninese cycling. At just 18, Georgette Vignonfodo is heading off the roads of Benin to take her journey up a gear with training in Switzerland. She is hoping to lead the way for more of the continent's female cyclists. She is the first since 1960 to go to national competitions and join a continental team. FRANCE 24's team on the ground met her.

events.title: Ukraine city of Kherson protects itself from drones with French fishing nets
events.summary: With an ever-increasing range, lightweight drones are a danger to soldiers and civilians alike anywhere near the frontlines in Ukraine. They can either act as kamikaze weapons in themselves, or drop small bombs and mines. In the southern city of Kherson alone at least 200 civilians have been killed in such attacks. To help defend against them, authorities in several Ukrainian regions have started putting up nets to protect roads and buildings. It turns out ordinary fishing nets do the job just fine – and French fishermen have been leading the effort to provide them.

events.title: Ukrainians sceptical after Russia announces agreeing to temporarily stop strikes
events.summary: Ukraine waited for signs on January 30 that Russia is abiding by a commitment that Donald Trump said he made to temporarily halt attacks on Ukraine’s power grid, as Kyiv and other regions are gripped by one of the most bitter winters in years. Russia suggested it would agree to the request; but scepticism remains. Ukraine said it would not strike if Russia didn't either.

events.title: Dr Hellyer: Challenge of meaningful reform in Iran: Tantamount to acknowledging 'revolution is over'
events.summary: Catherine Viette is pleased to welcome Dr H. A. Hellyer, Senior Associate Fellow at the Royal United Services Institute for Defence and Int'l Security Studies. In a wide-ranging interview, Dr. Hellyer highlights the strategic constraints of Iran, the ambivalence of Gulf states toward military escalation, and uncertainty gripping the region amid the highly unpredictable posture of US President Donald Trump. Maximalist demands, regional power realignments, and fears of post-regime chaos make diplomacy both urgent and elusive.

events.title: Japanese court holds North Korea accountable for deceptive repatriation campaign
events.summary: In a landmark ruling, a Japanese court has ordered North Korea to pay compensations to victims of a mass repatriation programme that ran between 1959 and 1984. More than 93,000 ethnic Koreans and their Japanese spouses were lured by the promise of a "paradise on Earth" with free education, healthcare and guaranteed jobs, only to suffer human rights abuses, poverty and famine. Yuka Royer speaks with Human Rights Watch's Kanae Doi about the significance of the court decision.

events.title: California 'Batman' demands US city council act against ICE
events.summary: A man dressed as Batman made an appearance at a city council meeting in California, demanding local authorities to not provide support for the US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE). Speaking rapidly and angrily, he accused council members of failing to act, using profane language to denounce what he called cowardice and inaction that put lives at risk.

events.title: Dua Lipa, Demi Moore and Victoria Beckham front row as Paris Couture enters a new era
events.summary: Paris is in full glamour mode as Haute Couture Week takes over the fashion capital and arts24 is front row for every defining moment. From headline-making celebrity appearances by Dua Lipa, Demi Moore and Dakota Johnson to historic turning points for the world's most powerful fashion houses, we unpack a season where style, culture and legacy collide. Fashion critic Samantha Tse joins us to break down the standout looks, the significance of Victoria Beckham receiving one of France's highest cultural honours and the renewed star power surrounding Couture Week.

events.title: Syria and Kurdish-led forces agree on ceasefire and phased integration deal
events.summary: The Syrian government ⁠and US-backed Kurdish forces have declared an integration deal.The agreement comes after government forces captured swathes of northern and eastern Syria from the Kurds this month, forcing them to retreat into a shrinking enclave. Under the agreement, ​forces will withdraw from the front lines, ‌government units will deploy ‍to the centres of Hasakahand Qamishli, and local security forces ‍will be merged.

events.title: With US-Iran talks, Turkey has "another opportunity to carve out its mediator role"
events.summary: Iran's top diplomat said that his country's missile and defence capabilities would "never" be on the negotiating table, as US President Donald Trump appeared to cool on threats of a strike after a military build-up in the region. He arrived in Istanbul earlier on January 30 for talks with Turkish officials, who have positioned themselves as intermediaries to try and de-escalate the situation. FRANCE 24's Rochelle Ferguson Bouyahi tells us more.

events.title: US and Iran have "little wriggle room" as tensions remain high
events.summary: Iran's foreign minister was in Turkey on January 30 as Ankara led a diplomatic push to mediate between Tehran and Washington, after US President Donald Trump cooled threats of an imminent strike on the Islamic republic. The standoff spurred calls for diplomacy from regional actors and allies of the rival countries. FRANCE 24's James André breaks it down for us.

events.title: French nurses sound the alarm on sexual violence in the workplace
events.summary: In France, nearly one in two nurses have reported experiencing sexual violence at work, this according to a new study by the country's Nursing Council. In 2025, more than two cases were reported each day, but despite this, reporting rates are extremely low. From this year, a simplified alert system will be available for victims.

events.title: Ghosts of the Atlantic: In Senegal, a bid to identify missing migrants
events.summary: Twenty years after the 2006 migration crisis, the Atlantic route between Senegal and the Canary Islands remains one of the most dangerous for migrants. In 2024, more than 10,000 people died or went missing there. With most victims dying anonymously, families and associations are trying to give them a name. FRANCE 24's Sarah Sakho and Simon Martin report.

events.title: Melania Trump documentary aired at premiere in New York
events.summary: The U.S. First Lady Melania Trump's documentary, "Melania" premiered on January 29, with political figures including House Speaker Mike Johnson, special envoy Steve Witkoff and, of course, President Donald Trump himself. The Amazon-funded film cost 75 million dollars for production and marketing, but some question whether it's a way for Amazon founder Jeff Bezos to get on the White House's good side.

events.title: Islamic State group claims deadly attack on Niamey airport in Niger
events.summary: The Islamic State group on Friday claimed responsibility for an attack in Niger on an air force base in the capital that wounded four soldiers and damaged an aircraft. State television reported that Niger's forces responded quickly to the assault early Thursday, killing 20 of the attackers and arresting 11 others.

events.title: Vintage Djokovic topples Sinner in five sets to set up Alcaraz final in Melbourne
events.summary: Novak Djokovic turned back the clock in a five-set classic on Friday to dethrone Jannik Sinner and become the ​oldest man to reach ‍the Australian Open final in the ​professional era. He ​will meet world number one Carlos Alcaraz in Sunday's decider, the Spaniard ‌having earlier battled past Alexander Zverev in another five-set epic.

events.title: ICE, lies, and videotape: How the press is covering the Minneapolis crackdown
events.summary: In separate incidents this month, federal agents in Minneapolis shot and killed two US citizens, Renee Good and Alex Pretti. Federal officials defended the agents involved in the shootings and offered different versions of events from state and local officials. Ordinary people with mobile phones provided crucial video footage that helped analysts and journalists find the truth. This week's guest on FRANCE 24's media show Scoop is Jasmine Garsd, a correspondent for National Public Radio.

events.title: Iranians feel "stuck between oppressive regime and the US government"
events.summary: Tehran and Washington have been trading warnings since Trump threatened military action over a deadly crackdown on protests. Pressure mounted after the United States moved a naval fleet into the region. Although he said he hoped it wouldn't come strikes on January 29, tensions remain high with Turkey placing itself as an intermediary between both parties to go through talks rather than action. FRANCE 24's Reza Sayah tells us more from Tehran.

events.title: Niger airport attacked by armed groups in first attack on strategic site
events.summary: In Niger, an attack targeted Niamey airport around midnight and went on for hours into the morning on January 29. This is the first time such a strategic site has been targeted. Niger's military leader has accused the presidents of France, Benin and Ivory Coast of supporting the armed groups which attacked the airport but provided no evidence to back up the accusation. Analysts believe the attack was led by jihadists, although no claim of responsibility has been made.

events.title: Iranians live in complete uncertainty over possible US military strikes
events.summary: The threat of a military strike against the Iranian regime continue to come from the US, while authorities continue to arrest people to quell protests. Iranians are in complete uncertainty between fears of violence and those of seeing the world turn a blind eye on their suffering. Trump first tweeted on January 2d that the US would react if protesters were killed: since then tens of thousands are believed to have been killed - with no US action on the ground.

events.title: Multi-million euro fraud scandal shakes Kenya's social security system
events.summary: In Kenya, the Ministry of Health has announced that the equivalent of 71 million euros has been stolen, misdirected or fraudulently clamed by hospitals and other healthcare facilites manipulated a new social security system. It had been meant to modernise the old system in a way that meant all Kenyans could access better health insurance but it apparently hasn't worked out that way. Here are the details from our correspondent in Nairobi, Bastien Renouil.

events.title: Texas police use tear gas to disperse anti-ICE protesters outside detention center
events.summary: Texas state police fired pepper balls and used tear gas to disperse demonstrators protesting outside the Dilley Immigration Processing Center, where 5-year-old Ecuadorian asylum seeker Liam and his father are being detained.

events.title: Scramble to reach starving communities in swamp-like conditions after devastating floods
events.summary: The broken banks of the Limpopo River are now faint snaking lines in a vast sea of brown, stagnant water that stretches out in every direction.

events.title: 'Children killed, women tortured': Civilians fear a full-scale conflict between Syrian and Kurdish forces
events.summary: Northeast Syria is rapidly changing hands, and with it the country's fragile balance of power.

events.title: Man City boss gives passionate speech in support of Palestinian children
events.summary: ​​​​​​​Pep Guardiola has given a passionate speech in support of Palestinian children and called for action.

events.title: Venezuela approves bill to open up oil sector to private firms
events.summary: Venezuela's interim president Delcy Rodriguez has signed a law opening the country's oil sector to privatisation.

events.title: Gazans face question of returning to devastated homeland as Rafah crossing reopens
events.summary: The reopening of the Rafah crossing feels like it should be an important moment. Symbolically, it is. From Sunday, people will be able to cross from Gaza to Egypt, and back again. Sort of.

events.title: Trump endorses deal struck with Democrats to avert government shutdown
events.summary: Donald Trump has endorsed a spending deal negotiated by US Senate Republicans and Democrats that would stave off a government shutdown and temporarily fund the Department of Homeland Security.

events.title: British girl, 7, missing after being hit by wave in Morocco
events.summary: A seven-year-old girl is missing after she was "swept away by a wave" in Morocco, an MP has said.

events.title: 'They told us to let them die': Iranian doctor speaks on regime crackdown
events.summary: In Iran, the climate of fear has been restored after the clerics who run this country successfully crushed a nationwide revolt.

events.title: China lifts sanctions on MPs and peers, Starmer says
events.summary: China has lifted restrictions on some British MPs and peers and will now allow all parliamentarians to visit the country, Sir Keir Starmer has said.

events.title: China executes 11 members of scam mafia family
events.summary: China has executed 11 members of a mafia family for killing 14 people and running a crime syndicate worth more than $1bn, authorities said.

events.title: Iran's top diplomat says there are no plans for talks with the US
events.summary: Iran's foreign minister says his country is ready for dialogue to resolve tensions but that there are no concrete plans for talks with the United States

events.title: Denmark unveils legal reform to allow the worst foreign criminals to be deported
events.summary: Denmark has unveiled a deportation reform under which foreigners who are convicted of serious crimes, like aggravated assault and rape, would be expelled

events.title: 41 militants killed in Pakistan military raids in the country's southwest
events.summary: Pakistan's military says 41 insurgents have been killed by security forces during two separate raids in the country's southwest

events.title: Uganda's army chief accuses US Embassy officials of aiding hiding opposition figure
events.summary: Uganda’s army chief accused U.S. Embassy officials of helping opposition leader Bobi Wine as he went into hiding

events.title: Through the eyes of Iranian protesters, glimpses of disorder, disarray and death
events.summary: Six Iranians spoke to The Associated Press about the protests in Iran, describing a renewed sense of hope even with a bloody crackdown on demonstrators

events.title: Hong Kong company’s concession to operate Panama Canal ports is ruled unconstitutional
events.summary: Panama’s Supreme Court has ruled that the concession held by a subsidiary of Hong Kong’s CK Hutchison Holdings to operate ports at either end of the Panama Canal was unconstitutional, an outcome that advances a U.S. aim to block any influence by China ...

events.title: Cause of plane crash in Colombia that killed 15, including Congress member, under investigation
events.summary: Colombian airline Satena says it received no prior warning of adverse weather before a plane crash killed 15 people

events.title: Venezuela’s acting president signs oil industry overhaul, easing state control to lure investors
events.summary: Venezuela’s acting President Delcy Rodríguez has signed a law that will open the nation’s oil sector to privatization

events.title: Mexico's Sheinbaum reiterates sovereignty in Trump call after Olympic snowboarder detained
events.summary: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum and U.S. President Donald Trump spoke over the phone on Thursday in the midst of a controversy over the arrest of a former Olympic snowboarder

events.title: Pope tells Vatican office that processes sex abuse cases to uphold truth, justice and charity
events.summary: Pope Leo XIV has told the Vatican doctrine office to uphold truth, justice and charity when deciding clergy sex abuse cases

events.title: Costa Ricans support Chaves’ successor in the presidential election as crime remains high
events.summary: Costa Ricans appear ready to vote to continue supporting the program of outgoing President Rodrigo Chaves in Sunday’s presidential election

events.title: Africa has the worst road safety record in the world. Here's what to know
events.summary: A deadly car crash in Nigeria involving former boxing champion Anthony Joshua and two minibus accidents in South Africa have highlighted Africa's poor road safety record

events.title: French energy giant TotalEnergies resumes Mozambique $20 billion project as insurgency slows
events.summary: French energy giant TotalEnergies has resumed its $20 billion gas project in northern Mozambique

events.title: The European Union sanctions 15 officials and 6 organizations in Iran over brutal crackdown on protesters
events.summary: The European Union sanctions 15 officials and 6 organizations in Iran over brutal crackdown on protesters

events.title: UN food agency is shutting down operations in rebel-held northern Yemen, officials say
events.summary: U.N. officials say the World Food Program is shutting down its operations in northern, rebel-held part of Yemen

events.title: At least 11 killed in a crash involving a minibus taxi and a truck in South Africa
events.summary: A crash involving a minibus taxi and a truck has killed at least 11 people in South Africa

events.summary: Confusion reigned about whether Russian President Vladimir Putin had agreed to halt strikes on Ukraine after President Donald Trump said he asked him to stop.

events.title: Unnerved by Trump, U.S. allies are making nice with China
events.summary: Since the start of the year, as President Donald Trump has alienated U.S. allies with his attack on Venezuela, demands for control of Greenland and new tariff threats, their leaders have been reviving ties with another country: China.

events.title: Russia faces a heavy price for limited gains in Ukraine war, death toll estimates suggest
events.summary: After nearly four years, the grinding war between Russia and Ukraine is approaching a staggering battlefield toll: nearly half a million dead and 1½ million wounded or missing across both sides

events.title: ICE role at the Winter Olympics prompts fury in Italy
events.summary: Italian officials reacted with anger at the news that a part of ICE, Homeland Security Investigations, will play a role in Olympic security next month.

events.title: Shaped by ancient humans, 430,000-year-old wooden tools are the oldest ever found
events.summary: Used by our early human ancestors around 430,000 years ago, the earliest known hand-held wooden tools have been uncovered by researchers in Greece.

events.title: Remains of last Israeli hostage found in Gaza, paving way for next phase of ceasefire
events.summary: The remains of the last hostage held in Gaza have been identified, the Israeli military said Monday, ending a more than two-year saga for captives' families in Israel — and paving the way for the second phase of the ceasefire in the war-torn enclave.

events.title: Alex Honnold describes his rope-free climb up Taipei 101 skyscraper
events.summary: Stay present for each move at a time, over and over.

events.title: Iranians return to daily life in a capital scarred by deadly protests
events.summary: TEHRAN, Iran — Massive protests rocked Iran in recent weeks but appear to have largely subsided after a brutal crackdown that has left at least 3,117 dead, according to official figures

events.title: Trump praises U.K. troops after backlash over NATO 'front lines' remarks
events.summary: President Donald Trump on Saturday commended British troops who fought in Afghanistan, backtracking on earlier remarks that drew criticism from NATO allies

events.title: Jared Kushner's vision for Gaza as a gleaming port city clashes with reality
events.summary: President Donald Trump’s son-in-law Jared Kushner this week unveiled plans for a “New Gaza” filled with gleaming high-rise towers and tourist-packed beaches — an optimistic vision that stands in stark contrast to the reality of a territory in ruins after two years of war

events.title: Pentagon shifts focus away from China in new defense strategy
events.summary: The previous National Defense Strategy – a document published every four years – identified China as the most significant strategic competitor to the U.S.

events.title: Prince Harry says British troops deserve 'respect' after Trump's NATO comments
events.summary: Prince Harry, who served in the war in Afghanistan, said the “sacrifices” of British soldiers during the conflict there “deserve to be spoken about truthfully and with respect” — a rebuke of President Donald Trump’s comments about NATO soldiers

events.title: Alex Honnold's ropeless climb of Taipei 101 skyscraper rescheduled due to weather
events.summary: Towering high above Taiwan’s capital city at 1,667 feet, Taipei 101 has captured the imagination of professional rock climber Alex Honnold for more than a decade.

events.title: Vance announces expansion of 'Mexico City' foreign aid restrictions to add DEI and gender
events.summary: The Trump administration will expand the "Mexico City" policy that restricts U.S. aid to foreign organizations that provide or promote abortions to include advocates of "radical gender ideologies" and diversity, equity and inclusion policies, Vice President JD Vance announced Friday at the March for Life."Now we're expanding this policy to protect life, to combat DEI and the radical gender ideologies that prey on our children," Vance told the crowd in Washington, D.C.Vance added that the Mexico
